title: Engine cranks but does not start
symptoms: Starter turns engine but engine never fires
Smell of fuel or not
Happens both hot and cold
possible_causes: No fuel pressure (failed fuel pump, relay, clogged filter)
No spark (ignition coil, crankshaft sensor, plugs)
recommended_actions: Listen near fuel tank for fuel pump hum when key is turned to ON
Check instrument cluster for immobilizer or key warning light
If you have a spare key, try starting with it
Have a mechanic test fuel pressure and ignition spark with proper tools

title: Engine will not crank at all (no sound)
symptoms: Turn key or press start button and nothing happens
Dash lights may dim or flicker
No clicking from starter
possible_causes: Faulty starter motor or starter relay
Gear selector not fully in Park or clutch switch issue on manual
recommended_actions: Check if interior lights and horn are strong or very weak
Inspect battery terminals for corrosion and tightness
Try starting with brake fully pressed and moving shifter from Park to Neutral
If jump-start works, have battery and charging system tested soon

symptoms: Rapid or single click when turning the key
Lights may dim during attempt
Engine does not turn
recommended_actions: Try another start with all accessories off (AC, radio, lights)
Check battery terminals and ground connection to chassis
If available, try a safe jump-start
If issue repeats with good battery, starter likely needs inspection or replacement

title: Engine misfires or runs rough
symptoms: Shaky idle, especially at stoplights
Loss of power when accelerating
Check engine light may flash
possible_causes: Worn spark plugs or ignition coils
Vacuum leaks or air intake problems
recommended_actions: Avoid hard acceleration until repaired to protect catalytic converter
Use an OBD-II scanner to read misfire codes (P0300–P030X)
Replace worn spark plugs according to service interval
Have mechanic smoke-test intake system for vacuum leaks if misfire persists

title: Engine overheating
symptoms: Temperature gauge in red zone or overheat warning
Steam or hot smell from engine bay
Heater may blow cold air while overheating
possible_causes: Low coolant level or coolant leak
Blocked radiator or water pump failure
recommended_actions: Safely pull over and shut engine off immediately to prevent damage
Do not open radiator cap while engine is hot
After cooling, check coolant reservoir level and any obvious leaks
Arrange towing and professional inspection before driving long distance again

title: Coolant loss with no visible puddle
symptoms: Coolant reservoir level slowly drops over days or weeks
Sweet smell occasionally inside cabin or from engine
Windows may fog with greasy film when heater is on
possible_causes: Small external coolant leak evaporating on hot engine
Head gasket leak allowing coolant into cylinders or exhaust
recommended_actions: Check for dried coolant residue (white or green crust) around hoses and radiator
Inspect passenger floor for damp carpet or sweet smell
Have a pressure test and possibly chemical test for head gasket done by mechanic

title: White smoke from exhaust
symptoms: Thick white smoke that does not disappear quickly
Sweet smell from exhaust
Coolant level dropping
possible_causes: Coolant entering combustion chamber (head gasket, cracked head)
recommended_actions: Do not continue long drives in this condition
Monitor temperature gauge closely; stop if overheating
Have compression and leak-down tests done to confirm head gasket or engine damage

title: Blue smoke from exhaust
symptoms: Bluish smoke, especially on startup or acceleration
Oil level drops between changes
Spark plugs may foul
possible_causes: Worn piston rings or cylinder walls
Turbocharger oil seal failure (if turbo car)
recommended_actions: Check oil level frequently and top up as needed to avoid low-oil damage
Avoid hard driving until cause is known
Have mechanic perform compression test and inspect PCV and turbo systems

title: Black smoke and poor fuel economy
symptoms: Dark exhaust under acceleration
Fuel consumption noticeably higher
Engine may smell rich and idle rough
possible_causes: Fuel mixture too rich (faulty O2 sensor, MAF sensor, fuel pressure regulator)
recommended_actions: Check and replace air filter if dirty
Scan for codes and pay attention to fuel trim and O2 sensor data
Have mechanic test injectors and fuel pressure if problem persists

title: Check Engine Light on
symptoms: Yellow or orange engine icon illuminated
Car may feel normal or slightly off
Sometimes flashes under heavy load
possible_causes: Many possible issues: emissions, misfire, sensor failure
Loose fuel cap causing EVAP leak code
recommended_actions: If light is steady and car drives normally, schedule diagnostics soon
If light is flashing or car runs rough, reduce speed and avoid hard acceleration
Use OBD-II scanner to read codes and document them
Do not ignore for weeks; small issues can damage catalytic converter over time

title: Battery warning light on while driving
symptoms: Red battery icon lit on dashboard
Lights may dim and electronics act strange
Engine may eventually stall as battery discharges
possible_causes: Bad alternator wiring or main fuse
recommended_actions: Turn off non-essential electrical loads (heated seats, rear defrost, audio)
Do not shut engine off until you reach a safe place because it may not restart
Have charging system voltage checked as soon as possible
If belt is broken or noisy, do not continue driving; arrange towing

title: ABS warning light on
symptoms: ABS light lit on dashboard
Brakes still work but may lock under hard braking
Sometimes traction control light also on
possible_causes: Damaged tone ring on axle or hub
recommended_actions: Drive more cautiously and avoid sudden hard braking
Have scan tool read ABS-specific codes
Inspect wiring and connectors at each wheel if visible
Plan professional repair; regular braking remains but no anti-lock function

title: Brake pedal feels spongy or soft
symptoms: Pedal sinks deeper than usual
Stopping distance feels longer
Brake warning light may appear
possible_causes: Air in brake lines from leak or improper bleeding
Brake fluid leak at caliper, hose, or master cylinder
recommended_actions: Do not drive at high speed; braking performance is compromised
Check ground under car for fluid leaks near wheels or under pedal area
Have system inspected, leaks repaired, and brakes properly bled
Replace brake fluid according to maintenance schedule

title: Steering wheel vibrates at highway speeds
symptoms: Vibration or shaking above certain speed (e.g., 90–110 km/h)
Vibration felt mainly in steering wheel
Improves or changes at different speeds
possible_causes: Uneven tire wear or separated tire belt
recommended_actions: Inspect tires visually for bulges, flat spots, or irregular wear
Have wheels balanced at tire shop
If vibration is severe or sudden, reduce speed and have tires inspected immediately

title: Car pulls to one side while driving or braking
symptoms: Vehicle drifts left or right when steering wheel is centered
Pull becomes stronger when braking
Uneven tire wear on one side
possible_causes: Sticking brake caliper on one side
Unequal tire pressures or tire damage
recommended_actions: Check and equalize tire pressures to factory spec
If pull is strong during braking, have brakes inspected immediately
Schedule wheel alignment and suspension check
Do not ignore strong pulling; it can be dangerous in emergency stops

title: Grinding noise when braking
symptoms: Metallic grinding sound when applying brakes
Noise worse with harder braking
Brake performance reduced
possible_causes: Brake pads completely worn down to metal backing
Foreign object caught between pad and rotor
recommended_actions: Avoid driving except for short distance to workshop if absolutely necessary
Have brakes inspected and pads/rotors replaced as required
Expect possible higher repair cost if pads were ignored for long time

title: Clunking sound over bumps
symptoms: Single or repeated clunk from front or rear when going over bumps
Noise sometimes when turning slowly
Handling may feel loose
possible_causes: Worn stabilizer (sway bar) links or bushings
Worn ball joints or control arm bushings
recommended_actions: Reduce speed on rough roads until inspected
Have suspension checked for play and worn components
Replace worn parts promptly to avoid losing control or uneven tire wear

title: High-pitched squeal while driving (changes with speed)
symptoms: Constant squeal or chirp that rises with vehicle speed
Noise may stop when braking lightly
Often from one wheel area
possible_causes: Brake wear indicator touching rotor (pads near end of life)
Small stones caught between shield and rotor
Worn wheel bearing (sometimes more growl than squeal)
recommended_actions: Test whether very light brake pressure changes the sound; if yes, suspect pads
Inspect wheel area for small stones or debris if safe
Have mechanic inspect brake pad thickness and wheel bearings

title: Growling or humming noise that increases with speed
symptoms: Low-pitched hum or growl from one side of car
Noise increases with road speed, not engine speed
May change when steering gently left or right
recommended_actions: Note if sound gets louder when steering weight onto one side
Inspect tire tread for cupping or feathering
Have shop test-drive and identify which bearing or component is noisy
Do not ignore loud bearing noises; bearing failure can be dangerous

title: Automatic transmission slipping
symptoms: Engine revs increase but car does not accelerate proportionally
Shifts feel delayed or flare in RPM between gears
Burnt smell from transmission area
recommended_actions: Check transmission fluid level and color if your car has a dipstick (follow manual procedure)
Do not tow or race the car in this condition
Have transmission specialist perform diagnostics and fluid change if appropriate
If slipping is severe, driving further may cause complete failure

title: Harsh or jerky gear shifts
symptoms: Noticeable jolt when shifting gears
Happens at certain speeds or throttle positions
No engine misfire
possible_causes: Software adaptation issue or outdated transmission firmware
Worn engine or transmission mounts exaggerating feel
recommended_actions: Check for any transmission-related error codes
Ensure fluid type and level are correct according to manufacturer
Ask dealer or specialist if transmission software updates are available
Inspect engine and gearbox mounts for cracking or collapse

title: Manual transmission clutch slipping
symptoms: Engine revs rise but vehicle speed does not increase accordingly
Most noticeable in higher gears under load
Burnt clutch smell after hills or heavy use
possible_causes: Oil contamination from engine or gearbox seal leak
recommended_actions: Avoid full-throttle acceleration to protect remaining clutch
Have shop perform clutch slip test and inspect for oil leaks
Plan for clutch replacement; it rarely fixes itself

title: Steering wheel off-center while driving straight
symptoms: Car goes straight but steering wheel is rotated left or right
Possible slight pull to one side
After hitting pothole or curb
possible_causes: Bent suspension component or tie rod
recommended_actions: Check tire pressures first and adjust to spec
Schedule alignment check and adjustment
If alignment cannot be corrected, have suspension and steering parts inspected for bending or damage

title: Vibration under acceleration only
symptoms: Car shakes mainly when accelerating, especially at certain speeds
Vibration reduces when coasting
Sometimes stronger uphill
possible_causes: Out-of-balance driveshaft on rear- or all-wheel drive
recommended_actions: Note if vibration changes when turning left or right under power
Inspect CV boots for tears and grease leaks
Have drivetrain inspected on lift by professional
Do not ignore loud clicking from CV joints; failure can leave you stranded

title: Fuel smell around car
symptoms: Smell of gasoline near car after parking
Smell stronger near rear or engine bay
No visible puddle sometimes
recommended_actions: Avoid smoking or open flames near vehicle
Inspect ground for wet spots under car
If smell is strong, do not drive; arrange towing to repair shop
Have fuel system inspected for leaks and EVAP system tested

title: AC blows warm air
symptoms: Air from vents not cold even on max AC
Compressor may click on and off frequently
AC worked better in past seasons
possible_causes: Low refrigerant charge due to leak
Blend door or control issue mixing hot and cold air
recommended_actions: Check if condenser fan runs when AC is on and engine is warm
Do not repeatedly top up refrigerant without leak detection
Have AC system pressure and vent temperatures measured by specialist
If only one side of dual-zone is warm, suspect blend door motor or door

title: Heater not producing warm air
symptoms: AC works but heat is weak or cold
Engine reaches normal temperature
Defrost function ineffective
possible_causes: Low coolant level or air trapped in cooling system
recommended_actions: Check coolant level only when engine is completely cool
If coolant is low, find cause of leak before just topping up
Have shop test heater core flow and blend door operation
Do not ignore persistent lack of heat; it can indicate cooling system issues

title: Windshield fogs heavily inside
symptoms: Interior glass fogs quickly, especially in rain
Film on glass that is hard to wipe clean
Sweet smell inside cabin
possible_causes: Moisture buildup from wet carpets or leaks
Heater core leak adding coolant vapor
AC not functioning in defrost mode
recommended_actions: Check carpets for dampness and source of water leaks
If windows fog with greasy film and sweet smell, suspect heater core
Use AC and fresh-air mode to clear fog while driving
Have cooling and HVAC system inspected if problem persists

title: Power window not working
symptoms: Window stuck up or down
Clicking sound but no movement
Other windows work fine
recommended_actions: Try window switch from both driver master panel and local door switch
If window is stuck open in bad weather, cover opening temporarily with plastic and tape
Have door panel removed and regulator/motor tested and replaced if needed

title: Door will not lock or unlock with remote
symptoms: Remote key fob works on some doors but not others
Mechanical key still works
Clicking but no movement in door
possible_causes: Central locking module or wiring issue
recommended_actions: Replace key fob battery and test again
Compare behavior from inside lock switch vs remote
If one door only is affected, actuator in that door is most likely
Have electrician or mechanic check wiring if multiple doors fail together

title: TPMS (tire pressure) warning light on
symptoms: Yellow tire icon on dashboard
One or more tires may look slightly low
Light may flash then stay solid
possible_causes: Low tire pressure due to normal air loss or puncture
Seasonal temperature drop causing pressure drop
recommended_actions: Use a tire gauge to check all four tires (and spare if monitored)
Inflate to manufacturer-recommended pressures on door jamb label
If light remains after proper inflation, have sensors scanned for faults
Do not ignore low pressure; driving on underinflated tire can cause blowout

title: Engine knocking or pinging under load
symptoms: Metallic ping or knock sound under acceleration or uphill
Often worse with low-octane fuel
May trigger knock sensor codes
recommended_actions: Use recommended or higher-octane fuel for your engine
Avoid heavy throttle if knocking occurs
Have mechanic inspect for codes and possible carbon buildup
Persistent knock should be addressed to avoid engine damage

title: Rattling noise from exhaust area
symptoms: Metallic rattle from under car, especially at certain RPM
Sound may be worse on cold start
Sometimes accompanied by exhaust leak noise
recommended_actions: Inspect visually for loose heat shields or hangers (when exhaust is cool)
Have exhaust system checked on lift by mechanic
If catalytic converter is rattling inside, plan replacement; performance and emissions can be affected

title: Strong vibration felt when braking at high speed
symptoms: Steering wheel shakes when braking firmly from highway speed
Brake pedal may pulsate
Often worse after long downhill braking
possible_causes: Uneven pad deposits on rotor surface
Loose suspension or steering components exaggerating vibration
recommended_actions: Avoid repeated hard stops until inspected
Have brake rotors measured and resurfaced or replaced as needed
Check suspension and steering for wear at same time
Do not ignore; braking efficiency and control can be reduced

title: Oil pressure warning light on
symptoms: Red oil can icon on dashboard
Sometimes flickers at idle then stays on
Engine may sound noisy or ticking
possible_causes: Worn oil pump or blocked oil pickup
recommended_actions: Safely pull over and shut off engine immediately to avoid major damage
Check oil level after allowing engine to cool a bit
If level is low, topping up may not solve underlying cause
Have oil pressure mechanically tested before further driving

title: Unusual ticking noise from engine
symptoms: Fast ticking that increases with RPM
More noticeable near top of engine
Sometimes louder when oil is cold
possible_causes: Injector tick (often normal but can be loud on some engines)
recommended_actions: Check oil level and correct if low
If noise appears suddenly or grows louder, have engine inspected soon
Describe whether noise changes when engine is fully warm; mechanic can distinguish lifter vs injector sounds

title: Car stalls at idle or when stopping
symptoms: Engine shuts off when coming to a stop or idling
Sometimes restarts immediately
May be worse with AC on
possible_causes: Dirty throttle body or idle air control valve
Fuel delivery or sensor issues (MAF, MAP, crank sensor)
recommended_actions: Note if RPM drops suddenly just before stall
Clean throttle body and check for cracks in intake hoses
Scan for codes and live data to see if sensors are reading correctly
If stalling is frequent, avoid busy traffic until repaired

title: Strong smell of burning plastic or wires
symptoms: Sharp, acrid odor inside or around vehicle
May accompany malfunctioning electrical components
Sometimes visible smoke from under dash or hood
recommended_actions: Safely pull over and turn off affected accessories or entire car if needed
Do not ignore smoke; exit vehicle if fire risk suspected
Have wiring and fuses inspected immediately
Do not continue driving with burning smell; risk of fire is serious

title: 4WD or AWD warning light on
symptoms: Indicator for 4x4, AWD, or differential lock lit or flashing
System may not engage or disengage correctly
Sometimes grinding or binding when turning
possible_causes: Problem with transfer case actuator or clutch
Wheel speed sensor or ABS-related fault
Incorrect tire sizes or heavily mismatched tread depths
recommended_actions: Avoid using 4WD on dry pavement unless required; it can cause binding
Check that all four tires are same size and similar wear level
Have codes read from AWD/4WD module and inspect actuators
If binding or grinding occurs, reduce use until system is diagnosed

title: Lane-keep or collision warning system malfunction
symptoms: Dashboard shows ADAS system error (lane assist, adaptive cruise, collision warning)
Cameras or radar sensors may be blocked
System disables itself
possible_causes: Camera or radar blocked by dirt, snow, or stickers
Sensor misalignment after minor collision or windshield replacement
recommended_actions: Clean front sensors, windshield area near camera, and rear radar if equipped
Remove any stickers or objects in front of camera or radar zone
If warnings persist, dealer may need to recalibrate sensors with special equipment
Drive with extra caution; driver-assist features may be unavailable
